titles.title: Cosmic radio noise data measured with a ground 30 MHz broad-beam riometer at Athabasca, Canada
titles.subtitle: 30 MHz broad-beam riometer data at ATH

subject_list.subject: Study of dynamical variation of particles and waves in the inner magnetosphere using ground-based network observations (PWING)
EARTH SCIENCE Sun-earth Interactions Ionosphere
Magnetosphere Dynamics
Cosmic radio noise absorption

affiliation.affiliation_name: Institute for Space and Earth Environmental Research, Nagoya University

edition.variation: The official release version for scientific use containing fully-calibrated data in physical units

rights_list.rights: Stations, Instruments, and Acknowledgements for the ISEE riometer data

description_list.description: Cosmic radio noise measured with a ground 30 MHz broad-beam riometer at Athabasca, Canada. The data consist of output voltage, quiet-day curve, and cosmic radio noise with a time resolution of 64 Hz. The quiet-day curve is derived from an average output voltage for a period from -15 to 15 days at the center of the observed day.

fund.funder_name: Japan Society for the Promotion of Science (JSPS)
